remarks: A nonempty set that is a subset of its union is infinite.  This version is proved from ~ ax-cc .  See ~ dominfac for a version proved from ~ ax-ac .  The axiom of Regularity is used for this proof, via ~ inf3lem6 , and its use is necessary: otherwise the set ` A = { A } ` or ` A = { (/) , A } ` (where the second example even has nonempty well-founded part) provides a counterexample.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2013.)
statement:
dominf.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
dominf $p |- ( ( A =/= (/) /\ A C_ U. A ) -> _om ~<_ A ) $.
